body:
> What's the difference between Coordinator and Editor?

@soc1c it just emerges from what has been happening in practice. A coordinator is like an assistant to editors and ecip authors, but with no technical skills, and no authorization to merge ecips or review software code. A coordinator has time to do housekeeping things.

Examples where I have been assisting editors:

1. I copied ECIP-1055 from ETC Labs Core to Ethereum Classic repo with the authorization of the author.
2. I reviewed and approved the latest ECIPs by Sorpaas (1040, 1068, 1069, etc.) because they were just copies of corresponding EIPs)
3. I reviewed and adapted texts of ECIP-1000
4. I moved ecip-1016 to "withdrawn" and added the original author with the author consent
5. many more actions

the reason for creating the formal "coordinator" position is that I thought to make it formal makes it more transparent as many actions are made by non-editors and that seems irregular in the system unless the "coordinator" role is added
